fields.description:
When notes are updated in upstream repositories, ref syncing correctly mirrors them but then fails to raise the {{RepositoryRefsChangedEvent}} for the update with the following error:

{noformat}
2013-10-09 15:41:59,715 WARN  [refsync:thread-1] amierzwicki 941x1250266x1 fryl9r 172.24.4.5 SSH - git-receive-pack '/KEY/upstream.git' c.a.s.i.r.sync.ForkRefSyncListener ~USER/fork[551]: Could not synchronize changes from KEY/upstream[81]
com.atlassian.stash.exception.ServerException: An error occurred while executing an external process: git fetch updated refs/heads/refs/notes/commits, but the ref does not exist
        at com.atlassian.stash.scm.git.common.command.GitCommandExitHandler.evaluateThrowable(GitCommandExitHandler.java:120) ~[stash-scm-git-common-2.8.1_1380678110000.jar:na]
        ...
{noformat}

This happens because the main {{RepositoryPushEvent}} includes {{RefChange}} entries for {{refs/notes/}} refs, but ref syncing (incorrectly) assumes that anything that is not a tag is a branch.
fields.summary: Ref syncing fails when notes are pushed

fields.description:
Long user and group names are not rendered completely, as per the attached screenshot. A mouseover will display the complete text but it may not be the most intuitive and user-friendly UI for instances with a lot of long user and group names, specially if the trailing part of them is the one that distinguishes one from the rest.
Would be helpful to have a better UI where these names can be completely viewed either by having a flexible dropdown that takes the longest name into account to set column width automatically or a control that allows users to expand to view the rest of the name.
fields.summary: Improve display for long user and group names

fields.description:
The [JIRA Integration guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/JIRA+integration] does not list [Create Branch|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Using+branches+in+Stash#UsingbranchesinStash-Creatingbranches] as an integration feature/point in this guide.
Please add this new integration feature to the guide.
fields.summary: JIRA Integration guide lacks Branch Creation feature

fields.description:
Really trivial notes :

1. https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Running+Stash+as+a+Linux+service#RunningStashasaLinuxservice-Usinganinit.dscript

the version should be latest version typically ... in this case 2.8.1 

2. in the init.d script the user is mentioned as vagrant ... but in the notes is mentioned as stash..

trivial suggestions .. but just for sake of completion.
fields.summary: Documentation update requests
Ahead and behind information is not visible on the branch page anonymously
Support Postgres 9.3
Remove "git@" from the SSH clone URL

fields.description: When attempting to display source view on files > ~34K, rendering process fails with error, "An error occurred while executing an external process: Resetting to invalid mark".
fields.summary: Source view fails with "Resetting to invalid mark" on larger source files

fields.description:
Given branch names that match JIRA issue regexes (e.g., branch_maintain_v7-2), merging those branches to master gives surprising results.

Since the branch name is in the commit message by default, branches appear as linked JIRA issues.

These branches then fail to show up in the branch list because the branch has been merged to master.
fields.summary: Branch information and jira links confusing in merge commit for branch names ending in a dash and a number

fields.description: When Stash performs membership queries against Crowd for users in directories which support nested groups, its pagination attempts may result in incorrect/duplicated results. This appears to only affect users with more than 100 direct groups, where 100 is {{Filter.FETCH_SIZE}} (a hard-coded constant the system uses while paging over memberships to reduce memory consumption).
fields.summary: Searching nested group memberships fails for users with a large number of groups

fields.description: When you are modifying the permissions at the repository level, it'd be useful if you could easily view the inherited permissions from the project; this could be available instantly or by clicking a button / check box to view/display them or not within the same screen.
fields.summary: Ability to view inherited permissions at all levels

fields.description:
When authentication via Trusted Applications fails, it produces a {{NullPointerException}} like follows from the {TrustedApplicationsAuthListener}}:

{noformat}
2013-10-03 10:27:01,060 WARN  [http-bio-80-exec-10] 627x524x1 10.0.23.18 "GET /mvc/error500 HTTP/1.1" c.a.s.a.t.f.TrustedApplicationFilterAuthenticator Failed to login trusted application: jira:12361033 due to bad URL signature.
2013-10-03 10:27:01,071 ERROR [http-bio-80-exec-10] 627x524x1 10.0.23.18 "GET /mvc/error500 HTTP/1.1" c.a.s.i.web.ErrorPageController There was an unhandled exception loading [/plugins/servlet/streams]
java.lang.NullPointerException: null
        at com.atlassian.stash.internal.auth.trusted.TrustedApplicationsAuthListener.authenticationFailure(TrustedApplicationsAuthListener.java:38) ~[stash-platform-2.8.1.jar:na]
        at com.atlassian.security.auth.trustedapps.filter.TrustedApplicationsFilter.authenticate(TrustedApplicationsFilter.java:124) ~[atlassian-trusted-apps-core-2.5.2.jar:na]
        at com.atlassian.security.auth.trustedapps.filter.TrustedApplicationsFilter.doFilter(TrustedApplicationsFilter.java:95) ~[atlassian-trusted-apps-core-2.5.2.jar:na]
        ...
{noformat}
fields.summary: TrustedApplicationsAuthListener.authenticationFailure produces NullPointerExceptions
Set and Get pull request options via the REST API
ORA-01795: maximum number of expressions in a list is 1000

fields.description: Support Oracle 12c as Stash backend database
fields.summary: Oracle 12c support
Prepend "git clone" to the clone URL in the clone button

fields.description:
We have a team with write permission for Stash project (and this team has several repositories). In this project, there is one particular repo with confidential data and password hash algorithms. Because of compliance issues that repo should be visible only to two developers, listed by name.

Project has default "No Access policy" and "write policy" for a developer team. Repository has disclosed list of devs (with read and write access) in repository permissions. Unfortunately anyone with write and read permissions for the project is able to see this particular repository content.

*Is there a way to restrict an access to this repository?*
fields.summary: Stash disable read for repository

fields.description:
Now merged PR in Stash:
{code}
7d5123f6b00807198857205944059096fd92c550	refs/pull-requests/4502/from
a57921adf02736e575d4102b9074687329c19a45	refs/pull-requests/4502/merge
a57921adf02736e575d4102b9074687329c19a45	refs/pull-requests/4502/merge-clean
d4202f5a4fce87b1e605c054210b7db87e14c7be	refs/pull-requests/4502/to
{code}
But ref `from` maybe used for CI server, and CI server retain to monitor it. Will be nice, if Stash will clean references after PR merged. Them not needed anymore, database contains all refs in anycase.
fields.summary: Delete refs/pull-requests/1234/* references after PR merged

fields.description: For user convenience, the username and password fields on Stash's login screen support auto-complete. However, in some organizations, this may not be acceptable security policy. At a minimum, Stash should offer a setting which disables auto-complete for these fields.
fields.summary: Disable auto-complete for authentication fields

fields.description: In environments where Stash's user directory is backed by a read-only LDAP server, password reset cannot work. Even in environments where it may be able to work, it may be desirable (for security or other reasons) to disable it.
fields.summary: Add support for disabling password reset functionality

fields.description:
Delete branch functionality should be inlined

Not sure if there's a technical reason for it but if it was inline (ie didn't reload the page) it'd make deleting lots of branches a lot easier. At the moment I think I have to scroll to the bottom again
fields.summary: Branch list: Delete branch without reloading the page

fields.description: You should be able to Delete a branch once you've clicked through to it
fields.summary: Delete branch from the branch actions drop down on the commit list

fields.description:
After attempting to upgrade to 2.8.1 unsuccessfully, I attempted to revert back to version 2.7.0, and find the following error in the log file..

JohnsonContextLoaderListener The Spring WebApplicationContext could not be started

A google search indicates this is because the STASH_HOME is at a different version than the current running version.  This is because I attempted to start 2.8.1 unsucessfully, and was unable to revert back to 2.7.0
fields.summary: Cannot start stash after upgrade from 2.7.0 to 2.8.1

fields.description:
Some users need to create lots of users in STASH UI when they start to use it.

If would be awesome if they could create various users at same time.
fields.summary: Bulk user creation UI

fields.description:
Today the REST API does not allow creating a user without a password.
{code}
curl \
    --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
    --location \
    --request POST \
    --user 'admin:password' \
    'http://localhost:7990/rest/api/1.0/admin/users?name=fbar&displayName=Foo%20Bar&emailAddress=foo.bar@example.com'
{code}

This would be really useful for users that need to create various users using a script.

As it is today, a password is needed and a script to create new users would need the password configured.
fields.summary: Create users without setting a password via REST

fields.description: The number of users set as approvers on a given pull request may change, in addition to being able to set how many approvals are required, an 'all' option would be useful meaning that regardless of the number of approvers, a unanimous approval is required.
fields.summary: All approvers option in Pull Request

fields.description:
*Scenario*
# In FishEye: if you click on the arrow in front of a folder or a package this part gets expanded you without page refresh. When you click a file, the source code will be shown directly in the right side of the screen in Fisheye.
# In Stash : For each selection in the file browsers there is a page refresh or site refresh and source code is not shown directly.

*What nice to have*
# The same feature as FishEye which can give the user more user usability to view the files using the tree viewer
fields.summary: Add File Tree browser in the Source Code view

fields.description:
Our legacy stash is using in-memory database. Now we built the new stash with oracle as the back end database. Is there any way we can export the data out and import it to the new stash, as same as jira?
We do not want any old configuration because the new stash environment use completely different certificate, https, ldaps and backend database. We just need the data in the in memory database.
We checked out this technote below but it migrate the whole stash server, which is not what we need. Please advise.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Migrating+Stash+to+another+server
fields.summary: migrate data from legacy stash to new stash

fields.description:
I've added several empty groups to LDAP. When I take a look at the groups listed in the user management of Stash, the empty groups don't appear in the listing. When I add a member to the group it shows up.

Nevertheless JXplorer also shows the empty groups.
fields.summary: Empty LDAP group not visible

fields.description:
When editing a pull request the reviewer user picker does not show. The REST API call to look up the username succeeds but display fails to render content. 

User reports this occurred upon upgrade from 2.7 to 2.8.
{quote}
I'm using firefox 24.0 on mac os x 10.8.4. I tried in safari too, and I tried clearing caches.{quote}

My test confirms that this was working in 2.7.0, tested with Chrome Version 29.0.1547.76 m

Note: Reviewers can be added when _creating_ the pull request.

There is an issue with the z-index of the dropdown which means that it is being hidden behind other page elements. 

This also affects adding a branch permission, @ mentions and the participants dropdown in a pull request.
fields.summary: Cannot set a reviewer when editing a pull request

fields.description:
The input field that contains the clone URL prevents the full URL from being accessible via the keyboard. I.e. you can not get to the end of the clone URL using the right arrow.

Workaround: Copy the URL and paste it into a text editor.
fields.summary: Cannot see the full clone URL (SSH/HTTP)

fields.description:
When you create a branch from within JIRA, it prefills in the branch name as ticket-number-summary. For example: "JIRA-1234 Testing Ticket" would have the box prefilled as "JIRA-1234-Testing-Ticket".

It would be nice to have the default branch name only be the ticket number, in this case 'JIRA-1234'.
fields.summary: Allow user to specify default branch name when creating branch from JIRA

fields.description:
Port http://xxx:7990 and https://xxx:8443 each works, but http is not automatically redirected to https as jira. We only use tomcat, no Apache.

Below is the server.xml. Please advise.

 <Connector port="7990" protocol="HTTP/1.1"
                   connectionTimeout="20000"
                   useBodyEncodingForURI="true"
                   redirectPort="8443"
                   compression="on"
                   compressableMimeType="text/html,text/xml,text/plain,text/css,application/json,application/javascript,application/x-javascript"/>

        <!-- A "Connector" using the shared thread pool-->

        <Connector executor="tomcatThreadPool"
                   port="7990" protocol="HTTP/1.1"
                   connectionTimeout="20000"
                   redirectPort="8443" />

        <!-- Define a SSL HTTP/1.1 Connector on port 8443
             This connector uses the JSSE configuration, when using APR, the
             connector should be using the OpenSSL style configuration
             described in the APR documentation -->

        <Connector port="8443" protocol="HTTP/1.1" SSLEnabled="true"
                   maxThreads="150" scheme="https" secure="true"
                   clientAuth="false" sslProtocol="TLS"
                   keystoreFile="/home/devstash/e1a-dev-stash.fabric.local/e1a-dev-stash.fabric.local-certificate-and-key.jks"
                   keystorePass="changeit"
                 />
fields.summary: stash http to https redirect does not work
Stash adds class "aui" to "table"-tags when inside markdown backtick code block

fields.description: When "There are too many files in this directory. Only showing the first 500" error message is displayed Stash shows all items in alphabetical order rather than folders then files as is the case when viewing folders\repos with under 500 items
fields.summary: Folder\File ordering when over 500 items

fields.description: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/216795/why-does-rest-require-extra-services-component-import-in-plugin
fields.summary: REST requires extra component-import in plugin.

fields.description:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/216018/how-to-force-up-branchselector-to-work-in-non-hook-plugin

All settings required for BranchSelector  had been turn on (https://developer.atlassian.com/stash/docs/latest/soydoc/branch-selector-field.soy.htm), but the selector still displayes empty dropdown.
fields.summary: BranchSelectorField doesn't work when appended to an intermediate non-DOM element with jQuery

fields.description:
TL;DR;

Every time someone adds or removes a reviewer in a pull-request, I'd like that activity to be recorded and shown in the overview of the pull-request with date and time.

!pull-request.png!

---

Long version:

For the past months as we've been using Stash, I noticed some developers have the habit of creating pull-requests very early (i.e. before feature is done), but not add any reviewer.

Then, they start adding commits to it for days, until one day they fell it's ready and then they add one or more reviewers.

I'm not 100% sure why they do that, but from conversations it seems they find it easier to detect when there are conflicts with the target branch but having a pull-request open from the very beginning (and they can rebase and push --force whenever appropriate) and that also allows them to use Stash's diff as they make progress with the feature their are building.

Now, the problem is that the overview page doesn't show when reviewers got added to the pull-request and that causes confusion.

Management is angry at "Mike" because there is a pull-request opened for 3 weeks and he didn't review it yet.

However, "Mike" was added as a reviewer just this morning.

Now "Mike" is angry with the developer who did this... And with Stash...
fields.summary: Pull-request overview should show add/remove reviewers activity

fields.description:
The merge button is currently highlighted blue which leads to those on reviews who have the appropriate rights to accidentally click merge instead of approve.

Could you please make merge the same color as the rest of the buttons so that it doesn't stand out as much (or only highlight it if the change is approved)?
fields.summary: Merge button should not be a different color

fields.description:
Per STASH-2839, even small development teams generate too much email traffic from Stash. While that ticket suggests digest-like functionality, I think that a free Stash notification client (for OS X, Windows, Linux, iOS and Android apps) would be a good idea.

It would be able to notify on every change to open PRs that the user is associated with and show a # of notification on the app icon. After clicking on the app icon, it would show a list of open PRs that the user is associated with (scrollable) with the most recently notified PRs on top and # of new notifications by each open PR as a number by the PR name.

See attached mockup. In addition, this would mean that Stash would need to keep track of whether a commit/comment had been viewed, which is mentioned in STASH-3781. (Unread comments/commits with new messages should possibly either be moved to top or stash browsing UI should allow a way to hide everything but commits with unviewed comments and should identify new comments. The interface should also be usable with these changes if developers have the PR open and are in the middle of making comments while others are commenting with minimal distractions; possibly a single number in the interface in the upper-right that increments as new things are happening in the background, and when click on that it shows a summary list of new events to PRs without redirecting from the current page where a comment might be in-progress.)

It doesn't have to be exactly like this to work, but just providing an idea for something that would help developers organize and deal with a lot of comments on commits on various PRs that may have happened in the hours that they were away while still allowing people to work with Stash in real time.
fields.summary: Stash Notification Client

fields.description: Stash doesn't escape HTML in commit messages at least in pull requests which creates a security risk if people submitting pull requests aren't fully trusted.
fields.summary: Stash doesn't escape HTML in commit messages

fields.description:
The branch will be created without the double quotes ({{"}}), but the overall operation will fail because branch creation requested will not match the branch creation performed. This will be fixed in a future version of Stash, but it is best practice (and we strongly recommend) not to use double quotes in branch names. 
This only affects Stash running on MS Windows.
fields.summary: Creating a branch containing double quotes in the name will fail on Windows

fields.description:
For example, if the branch {{release}} already exists, then attempting to create branch {{release/1.5}} will fail with an error message similar to the following: 

!https://www.monosnap.com/image/buv9AD9AN2RuWMFaHaUX9QQMi.png!

This behaviour is a limitation with how git uses the filesystem to store refs. A more descriptive error message will be added in a future version of Stash.
fields.summary: Creating a branch in Stash with a prefix that matches an existing branch will fail
Developer documentation: Plugin example mistakes

fields.description:
When viewing the Build Status for a given PR overall, as well as for individual commits, a single Build Failure will result in the overall Build Status to be shown as Failure even when subsequent builds are successful.

Note how the overall PR build status shows failure (far right), but the popup build history shows the most recent build was successful:
(see BUG-OverallBuild.png)

Here again, note how the given commit (the top one) shows build failure (far right), but the popup build history for it shows the most recent build was successful:
(see BUG-CommitBuild.png)

I am seeing this behavior on Stash v2.6.2 while using the Jenkins webhook v1.1 (https://github.com/Nerdwin15/stash-jenkins-postreceive-webhook).  I filed an Issue there first (https://github.com/Nerdwin15/stash-jenkins-postreceive-webhook/issues/29), but I can't see any spot in the plugin code where this icon choice would be controlled.  Thus, I'm guessing it's an overall behavior in Stash itself.
fields.summary: Build Success does not clear the overall Build Failure status

fields.description: We are trying to make the Stash usage for our internal developers as easy as possible. Because we are not using Hip Chat, i would like to remove the Hip Chat Plugin from Stash. Is this possible?
fields.summary: Make Hip Chat Plugin Removable

fields.description:
Follow this unanswered question in Atlassian Answers, i describe my thoughts here.

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/212418/reduce-of-rebuilding-automerge-commits

The problem:
Stash create refs/pull-requests/1234/merge-clean reference lazily after branches from and to has been updated in PR and PR request is reviewed. If your continues integration server look for merge-clean references it start retest such commit on every update.

There are case, then, if you already tested Automerge commit before and you pull request has been rebuilded (other one is merged) and you lost all these tests, you need to wait until you get new tests completed. In our case it takes a hour per each platform. But a hour at least. Then you get next pull request merged and so on. Rebuilding green pull requests again and again. Because Automerge commit updated on everyone pull request merged.

Solution:
Some plugin, is to have to add special reference and hook per repo:
`refs/pull-requests/1234/queue/to` and `refs/pull-requests/1234/queue/merge-clean`

If `queue/to` ref is equals to original `to`, plugin will replace original `merge` references to `queue/merge-clean` sha1 hash. And then try to merge again.

In other pull requests link `queue\to` is pointed to parent Pull Requests reference to, like a linked list.

In case if all pull requests has Automerge green on continues integration -- all of them can be merged without rebuilding Automerge commit. Just fast-forward `to` branch to last green in queue.

If someone PR is red on Automerge with queue, this pull request is putted into end of queue and all tail of queue rebuild Automerge commits again. Not all of rest, but only a tail from first red Automerge commit.

Sure this can be a plugin. And we are developing it now. But how you think, maybe it must be in core of Stash?
fields.summary: Pull Requests merge queue

fields.description: Under the bin folder for jira there is a config.sh to configure https and ldaps for jira, but under the bin folder for stash, there is no such confish.sh. How can I configure https and ldaps for stash? Which keystore file does it use for the ldaps?
fields.summary: how to configure https and ldaps for stash?

fields.description: Currently there is no obvious way to navigate from the pull request page to the repository the pull request is from. On BitBucket, this is solved by having the branch/repo names in the gray boxes clickable. It would be nice if it worked like that on Stash as well.
fields.summary: Branch/repo names on the pull request page should be links

fields.description:
Just like Jira, I'd like if stash had the code formatter: {noformat} {code} {noformat}
as an alternative to Markdown in comments.
fields.summary: Wiki Markup Support

fields.description:
On a project with multiple related repositories, pull requests are kind of hidden and it's not easy to follow new pull requests, unless somebody explicitly marks me as a reviewer.

It would help to have a project-wide "Pull Requests" page that would aggregate pull requests from all repositories under the project.

I've created as a workaround https://bitbucket.org/lalinsky/stash-all-pull-requests, but it only works well for really all pull requests, not project-specific pull requests, because there is no API in {{PullRequestService}} to filter pull requests by project.

Would it be possible to add the project-specific part of the add-on to Stash, or at least add some methods to {{PullRequestService}} to get all pull requests under project and to just return the count, not the actual pull requests?

Thank you.
fields.summary: API: PullRequestService - filter pull requests by project

fields.description:
Our typical use of Jira and git (following the git-flow model) is to create a feature branch related to an issue in Jira and, when work is complete, request that branch to be pulled back to the develop branch. Typically, the individual commits on the feature branch do not reference a Jira key, so, the Pull Request will not reference any Jira issues.

We would like issue key to be included in the pull request summary along with any Jira issues referenced in commits related to the request.

For example, for issue JIRA-1234, we create branch feature/JIRA-1234 off develop and commit related changes:
abc1234 added feature
def2345 fixed bug

We then create a pull request:
feature/JIRA-1234 -> develop

In that pull request, we want the Jira issue to be referenced, in the details and/or in the Jira issue summary on the right.
fields.summary: Link issue to a Pull Request via the branch name

fields.description:
Some users question us why in Stash we can't define the destination directory as in JIRA.

They want to be able to do that.

In JIRA (attached screenshot) we can choose where the user is created.
fields.summary: Change directory when creating user

fields.description:
When performing a pull request I would like to be able to send a notification (via Stash) to the pull request author when I have finished adding comments that then need to be addresses. Likewise I would like a notification that the comments have been addressed. Ideally this would be applicable to my comments rather than just the comments of all reviewers. So a for  a pull request with two reviewers, the pull request author can notify each reviewer independently that their comments have been addressed.

This would facilitate a more asynchronous code review as all parties are kept informed when it is _'their turn'_.
fields.summary: As a pull request reviewer I would like a Pull request to track 'whose turn it is next' in the review

fields.description: Currently Stash only seems to display a list of Pull Requests for which I am a reviewer. I would like to be able to see a list of all the pull requests that I have raised and be able to filter this based on their status, **Merged**, **Declined** or **In Progress**
fields.summary: As a stash user I would like to be able to see all the pull requests I raised

fields.description: Plugin developers currently have to indirectly infer the effective permission of an user. However, since 2.0, Stash is internally able to compute the permission graph of an user, and also use that functionality to fetch all the user's permissions once and fulfill the subsequent permission checks in-memory. Ideally the former functionality, the ability to compute an user's effective permissions, should be exposed to plugin developers.
fields.summary: Exposes effective permissions of a user to plugin's developer and UI
Pull requests: Diff context

fields.description:
Stash can throw 500 errors when loading the history of a file if the repository has a {{.mailmap}} file in its root and Stash is using Git 1.8.2 to 1.8.4 (on Linux or Windows).

This is because those versions of Git do not properly handle a {{.mailmap}} files if the file does not end with a newline: [http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.version-control.git/232938].

The bug was introduced in Git 1.8.2, by the combination of:
- [086109|https://github.com/git/git/commit/086109006f695166daf2934417a20681b0c94ab8], which adds the function {{read_mailmap_blob}} with the bug,
- and [8c473ce|https://github.com/git/git/commit/8c473cecfd8835c2bdf34b323e1b2de620099c04], which makes the Git executable look for a {{.mailmap}} file in the current HEAD (rather than the repository's root) on bare repositories.

The motivation for the change is described in more detail on [8c473ce|https://github.com/git/git/commit/8c473cecfd8835c2bdf34b323e1b2de620099c04].

A side effect of this bug is that any {{git rev-list}} command run with [pretty printing|https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/git-rev-list.html#_pretty_formats] and the following options {{%aN}}, {{%aE}}, {{%cN}} or {{%cE}} will fail with a segmentation fault. Those options are equivalent to {{%an}} (author name), {{%ae}} (author email), {{%cn}} (committer name) or {{%ce}} (committer email), but use the {{.mailmap}} information if it is available. Since loading the {{.mailmap}} file segmentation faults when the file is not terminated by a new line, the {{rev-list}} command fails with the same error.

A patch by Jeff King ([f972a16|https://github.com/git/git/commit/f972a1658a30809db113a3c486b1fe95b56633bf]) was merged to Git's master and [will be included|https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/gitworkflows.html#_graduation] in its next version.
fields.summary: Git's native .mailmap handling generates 500 errors in Stash for Git 1.8.2 to 1.8.4

fields.description:
As per announced in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/End+of+support+announcements+for+Stash Stash 3.0 ends support for Java 6.
It would be awesome if you could provide a distribution of these future Stash versions that is bundled with its own JVM, as in the case of JIRA. 
This will make life a lot easier for people who don't really have much of a say as to what version of JVM would be available on their box (which are typically managed by someone else).
fields.summary: Release Optional Stash bundled with its own JVM like JIRA

fields.description: It would be useful for people writing custom git hooks to have access to the repository/project name in their hooks. It might be nice if this was available through an environment variable (e.g. REPO_NAME and PROJECT_NAME).
fields.summary: Make repository/project name available to git hooks

fields.description:
When a trusted application link is updated, the original restrictions are replaced by the new ones. If one or more of the restrictions is unchanged, it causes the following error:

{noformat}
Next Exception: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "uk_trusted_app_restrict"
  Detail: Key (trusted_app_id, restriction_type, restriction_value)=(3, 0, 127.0.0.1) already exists.
        at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2102)
        at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.processResults(QueryExecutorImpl.java:1835)
        at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.execute(QueryExecutorImpl.java:407)
        at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.executeBatch(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:2737)
        at com.jolbox.bonecp.StatementHandle.executeBatch(StatementHandle.java:469)
        at org.hibernate.engine.jdbc.batch.internal.BatchingBatch.performExecution(BatchingBatch.java:110)
        at org.hibernate.engine.jdbc.batch.internal.BatchingBatch.doExecuteBatch(BatchingBatch.java:101)
        at org.hibernate.engine.jdbc.batch.internal.AbstractBatchImpl.execute(AbstractBatchImpl.java:149)
        at org.hibernate.engine.jdbc.internal.JdbcCoordinatorImpl.executeBatch(JdbcCoordinatorImpl.java:198)
        at org.hibernate.engine.spi.ActionQueue.executeActions(ActionQueue.java:372)
{noformat}

Specifically, this error occurs when the IP or URL patterns for a trusted application link is updated (under Admin > Application Links > click a link > Incoming Authentication > Trusted Applications).

A workaround is to:
* clear both the IP patterns _and_ URL patterns fields
* click the 'Update' button.
* click 'Incoming Authentication' again
* enter the desired IP patterns and URL patterns settings
* click the 'Update' button.
fields.summary: Updating a trusted application fails with unique constraint violation on uk_trusted_app_restrict

fields.description:
When a pull request is updated, the approvals remain. In the Confluence dev team, we're currently using [the auto-unapprove plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.stash.plugin.stash-auto-unapprove-plugin] that clears out the approvals. This isn't ideal either, because it isn't obvious from looking at the review that the reviewer ever approved the change.

What would be ideal from my perspective as a team lead is if Stash indicated approvals that were made on an earlier version of a pull request with a different or greyed-out approval icon. In the tooltip for the approver, it could also say "Approved on an older version of this pull request."

If that isn't clear, let me know and I'll mock up an example of what I'm suggesting.
fields.summary: Indicate which pull request approvals are "out of date"

fields.description:
During the maintenance window, following use-case would be feasible:
* Administrators can still log in.
* Users are temporarily denied access to the UI.
* Users are denied SSL/SSH access to repositories during maintenance windows.
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to be able to enable/disable users temporary during maintenance window

fields.description:
Background:
In my company we are in the process of introducing a development pipeline whereby stash is acting as an initial gatekeeper into the mainline git branch. We have configured stash to allow a pull request to be merged only if a peer review has taken place and a bamboo build has passed.

Problem:
The current solution which is suggested in order for new branches to be tested by bamboo is to use the automatically manage branches feature in bamboo. However this feature has two limitations.

- The time between scans for new branches is currently configurable only by using a command line parameter for the jvm. Its setting applies globally to all projects. Its default is 5 minutes. This default is too long when considering the feedback chain. "The earlier a bug is found, the cheaper it costs"
- The feature appears at least from the surface as inefficient and un-scaleable. I am willing to be corrected. I come to this conclusion as performing regular git operations (to check for branches) on a mounting number of git repositories seems wasteful when stash already knows about every individual change to the git repository.

Suggested Solution:
Stash introduces a repository post receive hook which
- Calls the bamboo api to create a new plan branch if it does not already exist. (/chain/admin/createPlanBranch.action)
- Instructs bamboo to build the plan branch
fields.summary: Introduce Ability to configure a stash repository to create a plan branch in bamboo on pushing to branch

fields.description: For the same reason as in STASH-2862 - we use AO to store the branch model data.
fields.summary: Non-ASCII values used as branch model prefixes/branch names don't work in MSSQL

fields.description:
{code} -module(foo). -define(STATE,State#state). Foo=1. {code} Arguably it's bad Erlang practice but that's a topic of its own. To test whether it was smtg wrong with highlight.js I used this html file: {code} 
    
-module(foo).
-define(STATE,State#state).
Foo=1.
{code}
fields.summary: Some Erlang files don't syntax highlight properly

fields.description:
Amber had some feedback from a Stash evaluator today asking why clicking on the "Raw" link for text files forces the file to be downloaded rather than rendered in the browser. 

We tested with .yml, .rb, pom.xml and .gitignore and they all triggered the browser to download the file (github seems to handle these filetypes fine).
fields.summary: "Raw" link for text files forces the file to be downloaded rather than rendered in the browser.

fields.description:
One of our developers managed to use a strange unicode character in his commit message. On the console in OS X, it displays as '<U+2028>'.

Once this was pushed and he opened a review request in stash, the review request appeared almost completely blank, and none of the buttons did anything when pushed.

When trying to view the commit, the commit also appeared empty.

We got him to amend the commit, and the commit is now visible in the commit viewer, but the review is still empty and the buttons still do nothing when pushed.

Not yet sure how to fix this. The pull request 'decline' button does not work, nor do any of the other buttons, and a new pull request can't be opened (get an error: There is already a pull request open between refs/heads/cal-46-ios-NewCallNotification and refs/heads/master. View the pull request.)

This seems to be the problem text: "llsme. Rece" (the character between the '.' and the 'R')
fields.summary: stash fails to display reviews/commits where commit message includes <U+2028>

fields.description:
In Settings - Permissions the "Default Logged-in Permissions" options are not working in this scenario:

A new  created project has "No access" as default, only allowing the Individual Users and Groups defined below to access the project. (That works fine)

If we set "Default Logged-in Permission" to "Read" this allows any user member of stash-users to read the project. (That works fine too)

Problem is the "Read" permission cannot be revoked, setting the project back to "No access" has no effect, all users that can login to Stash can see that project.
fields.summary: Default Logged-in Permission: "Read" to "No access" not working

fields.description: The commands on the "You have an empty repository" screen only show HTTP(S) even if you select SSH from the clone menu
fields.summary: You have an empty repository screen only shows HTTP(S)

fields.description:
It would be useful if the REST API included the ability to change the fork relationship between two repositories.

Specifically:
1. Make A a fork of B
2. Make A no longer a fork of B

The specific justification for this is that within our Stash environment we have managed projects of common code and deliverable projects that we use day to day.  Deliverable projects contain forks of repositories from managed projects.

Sometimes we need to promote a repository from a deliverable project to a managed project as it's becoming reusable.  At that point it would be nice to be able to mark the repo in the deliverable as a fork of the new one in the managed project.

This is advanced capabilities so I don't see any need for it to appear outside the REST API.
fields.summary: Fork Management API
Allow long description in the 'Build' field
The default project permission is not getting cleared from the cache

fields.description: There's a button for pull requests I have yet to review, but none for my currently open pull requests. Thus you currently need to track your open pull requests externally to avoid them being left for considerable time after they have passed code review before they they are merged.
fields.summary: Track pull requests I opened

fields.description:
Currently in the diff you see only the new file name, if a file was renamed or moved.
It would be nice to see also the old file name and path.
fields.summary: Show old file names of renamed/moved files in diff

fields.description:
Please add service headers into Mime Message of notifications from stash, like:
{code}
X-Atlassian-Stash-Event: Pull-Request-Merged | Pull-Request-Commented | Pull-Request-Declined | Pull-Request-Pushed-Changes | Pull-Request-Edited | Pull-Request-Added-as-Reviewer | etc
X-Atlassian-Stash-Event-Author: aefimov
X-Atlassian-Stash-Pull-Request-Id: 1234
X-Atlassian-Stash-Pull-Request-Author: someone
X-Atlassian-Stash-Pull-Request-From: my-branch
X-Atlassian-Stash-Pull-Request-To: master
etc
{code}
fields.summary: Add service headers into email messages of notifications

fields.description:
The change of the default transaction isolation level for MySQL in Stash 2.7 to _READ\_COMMITTED_ can prevent Stash from starting, because _READ\_COMMITTED_ is not compatible with MySQL's binary logging at the _STATEMENT_ level.

When binary logging is enabled, _STATEMENT_ level is the default level in MySQL 5.1.11 and earlier, MySQL 5.1.29 and later, and MySQL 5.5 ([5.1 documentation|http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.1/en/binary-log-setting.html], [5.5 documentation|http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.5/en/binary-log-setting.html]):

{quote}
If you are using InnoDB tables and the transaction isolation level is READ COMMITTED or READ UNCOMMITTED, only row-based logging can be used.
{quote}

The exception generated by Stash on startup is:

{noformat}
Caused by: liquibase.exception.LockException: liquibase.exception.DatabaseException: Error executing SQL UPDATE `stash`.`DATABASECHANGELOGLOCK` SET `LOCKED` = 1, `LOCKEDBY` = 'fe80:0:0:0:250:56ff:feaa:7715%14 (fe80:0:0:0:250:56ff:feaa:7715%14)', `LOCKGRANTED` = '2013-09-16 20:33:46.125' WHERE `ID` = 1 AND `LOCKED` = 0: Binary logging not possible. Message: Transaction level 'READ-COMMITTED' in InnoDB is not safe for binlog mode 'STATEMENT'
	at liquibase.lockservice.LockService.acquireLock(LockService.java:121) ~[liquibase-core-2.0.5.jar:na]
	at liquibase.lockservice.LockService.waitForLock(LockService.java:61) ~[liquibase-core-2.0.5.jar:na]
	at liquibase.Liquibase.update(Liquibase.java:102) ~[liquibase-core-2.0.5.jar:na]
	at liquibase.integration.spring.SpringLiquibase.performUpdate(SpringLiquibase.java:262) ~[liquibase-core-2.0.5.jar:na]
	at liquibase.database.DefaultingSchemaLiquibase.performUpdate(DefaultingSchemaLiquibase.java:57) ~[stash-dao-impl-2.7.1.jar:na]
	at liquibase.database.DefaultingSchemaLiquibase.afterPropertiesSet(DefaultingSchemaLiquibase.java:87) ~[stash-dao-impl-2.7.1.jar:na]
	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.invokeInitMethods(AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.java:1541) ~[spring-beans-3.2.3.RELEASE.jar:3.2.3.RELEASE]
	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.initializeBean(AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.java:1479) ~[spring-beans-3.2.3.RELEASE.jar:3.2.3.RELEASE]
	... 85 common frames omitted
Caused by: liquibase.exception.DatabaseException: Error executing SQL UPDATE `stash`.`DATABASECHANGELOGLOCK` SET `LOCKED` = 1, `LOCKEDBY` = 'fe80:0:0:0:250:56ff:feaa:7715%14 (fe80:0:0:0:250:56ff:feaa:7715%14)', `LOCKGRANTED` = '2013-09-16 20:33:46.125' WHERE `ID` = 1 AND `LOCKED` = 0: Binary logging not possible. Message: Transaction level 'READ-COMMITTED' in InnoDB is not safe for binlog mode 'STATEMENT'
	at liquibase.executor.jvm.JdbcExecutor.execute(JdbcExecutor.java:62) ~[liquibase-core-2.0.5.jar:na]
	at liquibase.executor.jvm.JdbcExecutor.update(JdbcExecutor.java:229) ~[liquibase-core-2.0.5.jar:na]
	at liquibase.executor.jvm.JdbcExecutor.update(JdbcExecutor.java:206) ~[liquibase-core-2.0.5.jar:na]
	at liquibase.lockservice.LockService.acquireLock(LockService.java:103) ~[liquibase-core-2.0.5.jar:na]
	... 92 common frames omitted
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: Binary logging not possible. Message: Transaction level 'READ-COMMITTED' in InnoDB is not safe for binlog mode 'STATEMENT'
	at com.mysql.jdbc.SQLError.createSQLException(SQLError.java:1078) ~[mysql-connector-java-5.1.25-bin.jar:na]
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:4187) ~[mysql-connector-java-5.1.25-bin.jar:na]
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:4119) ~[mysql-connector-java-5.1.25-bin.jar:na]
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sendCommand(MysqlIO.java:2570) ~[mysql-connector-java-5.1.25-bin.jar:na]
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sqlQueryDirect(MysqlIO.java:2731) ~[mysql-connector-java-5.1.25-bin.jar:na]
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.execSQL(ConnectionImpl.java:2809) ~[mysql-connector-java-5.1.25-bin.jar:na]
	at com.mysql.jdbc.StatementImpl.executeUpdate(StatementImpl.java:1811) ~[mysql-connector-java-5.1.25-bin.jar:na]
	at com.mysql.jdbc.StatementImpl.executeUpdate(StatementImpl.java:1725) ~[mysql-connector-java-5.1.25-bin.jar:na]
	at com.jolbox.bonecp.StatementHandle.executeUpdate(StatementHandle.java:536) ~[bonecp-0.7.1.RELEASE.jar:0.7.1.RELEASE]
	at liquibase.executor.jvm.JdbcExecutor$1UpdateStatementCallback.doInStatement(JdbcExecutor.java:221) ~[liquibase-core-2.0.5.jar:na]
	at liquibase.executor.jvm.JdbcExecutor.execute(JdbcExecutor.java:55) ~[liquibase-core-2.0.5.jar:na]
	... 95 common frames omitted
{noformat}

Workaround has been documented [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASHKB/Stash+2.7+fails+to+start+with+MySQL+when+binary+logging+is+enabled].
fields.summary: Stash 2.7 fails to start with MySQL when binary logging is enabled

fields.description: Any time that I try to merge in a pull request, I get an error saying that "New changes were pushed to develop in GEN/genesis while the merge was being performed. Please retry the merge.". I know that nobody else is trying to merge at this time, as I am able to go through source tree and merge the branch in through there.
fields.summary: Can't Merge pull requests

fields.description: As a project administrator, I would like to be able to change the default for repositories to not allow forking and also be able to specify other defaults such as the enablement of hooks at a project wide level.  This would allow me to set things once instead of having to set things for every repository created within the project and save time as I normally want to configure all of my repositories in a similar manner.
fields.summary: Set Project level defaults for ability to fork and hooks

fields.description:
*Steps to produce*
# Create a file with Umlaut characters, for example: {{Zylindrizität}}.
# Create the repo in Stash and push the files to Stash.
# Navigate to the file in the UI.

*Results*
The following error will appear in the UI:

The path "Zylindrizität" does not exist at revision "refs/heads/master"

and these errors will appear in the logs:

ServiceExceptionMapper Mapping ServiceException to REST response 404
com.atlassian.stash.exception.NoSuchPathException: The path "_Argillon_Projects/V144-059_CR006-2012 Zylindrizität" does not exist at revision "refs/heads/144-077_CR021-2013"
	at com.atlassian.stash.internal.scm.git.GitCommandExitHandler.evaluateStdErr(GitCommandExitHandler.java:70) ~[na:na]
	at com.atlassian.stash.internal.scm.git.GitCommandExitHandler.onError(GitCommandExitHandler.java:159) ~[na:na]
	at com.atlassian.stash.scm.DefaultCommandExitHandler.onExit(DefaultCommandExitHandler.java:35) ~[stash-spi-2.7.1.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.stash.scm.BaseCommand.callExitHandler(BaseCommand.java:141) ~[stash-spi-2.7.1.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.stash.scm.BaseCommand$CommandFuture.internalGet(BaseCommand.java:257) ~[stash-spi-2.7.1.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.stash.scm.BaseCommand$CommandFuture.get(BaseCommand.java:224) ~[stash-spi-2.7.1.jar:na]

fields.summary: "does not exist at revision" error when browsing files with umlaut characters

fields.description:
As of 2.6.4 Stash seems to generate the clone URL entirely from the configured application "base URL" without checking the URL the user is actually using.

This seems dangerous.

Consider a staging/test environment where the base URL is initially pointing at production because the database was a snapshot of the production database. An inexperienced admin (or simple oversight) may mean that the base url never gets updated in the test environment.

Users visit the test environment and quickly clone and start doing test pushes. If they don't happen to catch the fact that the clone url actually points at production they may start accidentally pushing very destructive commands.

git push --force or git push --mirror

(git push --mirror, for example, isn't caught by the provided "block git force push" hook.)

I'm not sure how strict the checking should be, but maybe display a big warning banner and refuse to generate clone urls until the base url is updated to match the current url.
fields.summary: SSH clone URL generation should take the request URL into account

fields.description: When attempting to install the latest version of the Communardo project-category plug-in.  In addition, Stash errors out when attempting to use the new plugin,
fields.summary: Error installing project category add-on for Stash: "An unexpected error occurred. Please refer to the logs for more information."

fields.description:
Hello,

I am currently testing Stash. I would like to use it with our team of 40 developers to ensure proper code reviews.

Our workflow is that if a branch is changed after the code review (approved), then the branch needs to be reviewed again. I installed the hook (Stash Auto Unapprove Plugin) which should to that, but unfortunately it doesn't do anything. After pushing to the source branch of the pull request, it is still approved.
fields.summary: Unapprove

fields.description:
Following [the instructions here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASHKB/Configuring+syntax+highlighting+for+file+extensions], I added this line to {{stash-config.properties}}, then restarted Stash:
{CODE}syntax.highlighter.python.extensions=py,SConscript,SConstruct{CODE}

Files named {{SConscript}} and {{SConstruct}} still do not have Python syntax highlighting.

This also might be an issue if _highlight.js_ ever [adds support for Makefiles|https://github.com/isagalaev/highlight.js/issues/201]; it would need to both match files ending with {{*.mk}} and files named {{Makefile}} without an extension.
fields.summary: Files without extensions should be able to have their syntax highlighter configured

fields.description: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/209946/stash-not-rendering-block-in-readme-md
fields.summary: Markdown - don't strip out dl/dd/dt tags

fields.description:
When one replies to a comment to a pull request, on an activity tab it stays where it is. It kills for me the usefulness of conversations under pull requests as the activity tab should always show latest activities. If I add a comment to a thread started some time ago, I'm almost certain the pull request creator won't see it as it's buried deep down.

BitBucket does this right; please, make it work this way as well.
fields.summary: Comment threads should be bumped to the top on any reply

fields.description:
Please see this question on atlassian answers:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/209946/stash-not-rendering-block-in-readme-md

Basically, <dl> elements and contents are not rendered when included in markdown.  I even tried placing the <dl> block inside a table with a single cell, but that didn't work.
fields.summary: <dl> block not rendered by Stash in README

fields.description:
According to the documentation stash only supports 3 values for the build status: SUCCESSFUL, FAILED and INPROGRESS.
The (popular) jenkins continuous integration server supports an additional state called 'unstable' to indicate that while the software builds, not all tests pass.

In order to integrate test results from jenkins it would be appreciated to have such a build state in stash as well.
fields.summary: Add 'Unstable' Build Status

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of July 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

I'm excited to share that in Bitbucket Server 7.2 we *improved pull request filtering*. From now, you can filter and search pull requests by title and the description. Additionally, you can filter by the list by a reviewer user.

We will keep the ticket open since we know it's only a small improvement and we want to solve more cases you mentioned.

You can find more information in the Bitbucket Server 7.2 [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-7-2-release-notes-1001823759.html].

Please, don't hesitate to leave feedback on the feature in the comments. This will help us to priorities further development.

Anton Genkin
 Product Manager Bitbucket Server
{panel}
Hi,

as we are getting more and more pull requests merged, we are missing the feature to search through the list of merged/decline/open pull requests. 
 The Search should at least search through the title of the pull request. Filtering by Author, Reviewer at least would be very helpful.

thx alex

Added from STASH-4307 - ability to search comment text also
fields.summary: Search for pull requests
I want a way to be able to see the activity of a user, their commits etc.

fields.description: Search results through "Repository Quicksearch" bar don't report substring matches that aren't at the start of the repository names (e.g. searching for "house" will find "house sparrow" but not "detached house")
fields.summary: Repository searching should use substrings

fields.description:
Like on Github:

https://help.github.com/articles/issue-attachments
fields.summary: Drag and drop upload of attachments in pull requests

fields.description: As Stash doesn't support 'x509' authentication yet, would be great having it
fields.summary: Support 'x509' authentication in Stash

fields.description:
As an admin user, I would like to retrieve the SSH keys for all users using the SSH REST API and not only for the "admin" logged in user as described by the [documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/rest/stash/2.7.0/stash-ssh-rest.html#idp32816].

Maybe for the "admin" user, I could retrieve all the SSH keys and, all the other users could keep the current behaviour (just retrieving their own SSH keys)?

For what its worth, the use case is such that we need to set up an external data store for some large binary files that are required to develop our product, but require no versioning. I'd like to grant access via SSH/Rsync, and if I could see these keys I could grant user's access without having to double their effort.
fields.summary: Retrieve all SSH keys as an admin user

fields.description:
Currently there is no way to stop users from creating repositories on their own personal space.

Users can either go to their personal space and create a repository by using the "Create Repository" button or they can also fork a repository in a Project that they have "read" permission into their own personal space.

A reported use case asks for the following:

- Ability to restrict repository creation in an attempt to avoid users creating repositories that the "admin" does not have control over.

- A better way as a "admin" to find all personal repos (this was already reported on [STASH-3564|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/STASH-3564]) and allow the "admin" to clean them up.

- Use case seems to be concerned on how to clean off personal repositories or eventual "garbage" that was left to lower disk usage down if necessary.
fields.summary: Restrict creation of personal repositories

fields.description: The problem in the Stash "commit" tab view is you only have a long list of commits with no lines marking parent-child rationalships, so following the history in the Stash UI can be rather difficult.
fields.summary: The Stash Repository Commits tab should show parent-child relationships rather then just a long list of commits

fields.description:
To reproduce:

* edit pull request
* right-click anywhere on the page
=> I can still change reviewers or title, but can't type in the description field
fields.summary: Edit pull request: Can't type in description field after right-click

fields.description: If a user has a fork of a repository, and is currently looking at the "source" repository, it would be very handy to have a "My Fork" link to take them directly to their fork of the repository.  There does not appear to be any indication in the forked repository that the user already has a personal fork.
fields.summary: "My Fork" link in source repository

fields.description: Per summary, for example group A has set of permissions for project A. After using LDPA, assuming I have group B in LDAP server, I'd like to map it with internal group A without the need to rename any group.
fields.summary: Support nested groups for the internal directory

fields.description:
The following Atlassian Stash documentation article, https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Running+Stash+as+a+Linux+service, provides a script to start and stop Stash via the service command.

The script makes use of a command called "log_daemon_msg."  When the command is run:
  service stash start

Errors appear:
  /etc/init.d/stash: line 80: log_end_msg: command not found
fields.summary: log_daemon_msg: command not found (/etc/init.d/stash: line 77)
